entries.content: When prospect says 'not now, maybe next year', agent asks 'may I ask why your team is looking into vials?'
entries.notes: Soft probe to understand the underlying reason or trigger for future interest, diagnosing timing vs. disinterest.

entries.content: 'I know you don't need anything, but may I have 30 seconds for me to tell you the reason why I called?'
entries.notes: Acknowledging initial 'not needing' to bypass the immediate brush-off and earn attention for the pitch.

entries.content: Lesson learned: Always get the meeting, even when the prospect indicates 'not now' or timing issues.
entries.notes: Reflection on handling a 'timing' objection; suggests pushing past initial 'not now' for a future meeting.

entries.content: Agent reflects on not pushing for a meeting when prospect was about to jump into a meeting, questioning if being too respectful was a mistake.
entries.notes: Highlights the tension between respecting prospect's stated timing/availability and the goal of securing a meeting.

entries.content: 'I'm sure they're not looking to change anything today and I'm sure you're getting the best deal possible...'
entries.notes: Acknowledging potential disinterest or satisfaction upfront when asking for a referral, lowering pressure.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
